title: Wire OpenClaw to Anti-Gravity for Autonomous Engineering
description: Transform your AI into a full autonomous engineering team by connecting OpenClaw orchestration with Anti-Gravity's specialist agents and free model access.

cards.title: Build an Autonomous Engineering Team
cards.body: You'll learn to wire OpenClaw to Google's Anti-Gravity for a powerful workflow where OpenClaw orchestrates tasks and Anti-Gravity executes with specialist agents. Access models like Opus 4.5 and Gemini for free while building complete apps from simple prompts. This takes about 35 minutes.

cards.title: The Perfect AI Workflow Architecture
cards.body: This integration creates a command center where OpenClaw handles planning and orchestration while Anti-Gravity handles execution with specialist agents trained for specific jobs.

diagram.caption: OpenClaw plans, Anti-Gravity builds with specialist agents

bullets: Builder agents: Create functional components and SaaS apps
Reviewer agents: Refine output and fix errors
Debugger agents: Identify and solve code issues
UX designer agents: Improve user experience

source.author: WorldofAI
source.description: See OpenClaw building complete apps through WhatsApp prompts

cards.title: Critical Security Warning
cards.body: OpenClaw is a local RCE (Remote Code Execution) risk. It can execute any command on your system, making it potentially dangerous if not properly contained.
cards.warn: Never run OpenClaw on your main system without proper sandboxing. Use a VM or isolated environment.
bullets: OpenClaw can execute terminal commands directly
It has full system access when running
Malicious prompts could damage your system
Always follow the official security documentation
cards.safe: The creator recommends using a virtual machine or sandbox environment for safety.

read.body:
OpenClaw's power comes from its ability to directly interact with your system - reading files, running commands, installing software, and making network requests. This makes it incredibly capable but also potentially dangerous.

The recommended security measures include:

Containerization: Run OpenClaw inside Docker containers or virtual machines to limit system access.

Permission Controls: Use restricted user accounts with limited file system access.

Network Isolation: Consider firewall rules to limit network access from the OpenClaw environment.

Regular Monitoring: Watch for unexpected system changes or network activity.

callouts.text: Production systems should never run OpenClaw with full administrator privileges.

cards.title: Install Node.js and OpenClaw
cards.body: First, ensure you have Node.js 22+ installed, then install OpenClaw globally using npm.
cards.codeCaption: This installs OpenClaw as a global command-line tool
bullets: Download Node.js 22+ from nodejs.org if not installed
Verify installation with node --version
The global install lets you run openclaw from anywhere

troubleshoot.label: Permission denied error
troubleshoot.fix: Use sudo npm install -g openclaw on Mac/Linux or run terminal as administrator on Windows

troubleshoot.label: Node version too old
troubleshoot.fix: Update Node.js to version 22 or higher from nodejs.org

cards.title: Enable Anti-Gravity OAuth Plugin
cards.body: Enable the Anti-Gravity OAuth plugin in OpenClaw to access Google's models through the Anti-Gravity platform.
cards.codeCaption: This plugin provides OAuth authentication for Anti-Gravity integration

troubleshoot.label: Plugin not found
troubleshoot.fix: Ensure OpenClaw is properly installed and you're using the latest version. Try reinstalling if needed.

cards.title: Authenticate with Google Account
cards.body: Log in with your Google account to access Anti-Gravity's free models including Gemini and Opus 4.5.
cards.codeCaption: This opens a browser window for OAuth authentication
bullets: Use any Google account (Gmail, Workspace, etc.)
Alternative: Use Gemini CLI OAuth or Vertex ADC
Google officially supports these authentication methods

troubleshoot.label: Browser doesn't open
troubleshoot.fix: Manually copy the auth URL from the terminal and paste it into your browser

troubleshoot.label: Authentication timeout
troubleshoot.fix: Try the command again and complete the browser authentication more quickly

cards.title: Quick Security Check
cards.question: Why is OpenClaw considered a security risk?

options.text: It sends your data to external servers
It can execute any command on your local system

cards.correctFeedback: Exactly! OpenClaw has RCE (Remote Code Execution) capabilities, meaning it can run terminal commands, install software, and access files on your system - making proper sandboxing essential.
cards.wrongFeedback: OpenClaw's main risk is its ability to execute system commands directly. It's essentially giving AI agents terminal access to your computer, which requires careful containment.

cards.title: Run OpenClaw Onboarding
cards.body: Initialize OpenClaw with the onboarding process to configure your provider, model, and communication channels.
cards.codeCaption: This interactive setup configures your OpenClaw installation
bullets: Read and accept the security warning carefully
Choose 'Quick start' for faster setup
Keep existing OAuth provider (Anti-Gravity)
cards.warn: The security warning is serious - consider running this in a VM or sandbox environment first.

troubleshoot.label: Onboarding fails to start
troubleshoot.fix: Ensure OpenClaw was installed globally with the -g flag and restart your terminal

cards.title: Select Anti-Gravity Models
cards.body: During onboarding, choose Google's Anti-Gravity as your provider and select from powerful models like Opus 4.5 Thinking or Gemini.
bullets: Provider: Select Google Anti-Gravity
Model: Choose Opus 4.5 Thinking or Gemini 3
Both models are available through Anti-Gravity's free access

concept.text: Anti-Gravity provides free access to premium models that would normally cost hundreds per month through direct APIs.

cards.title: Choose Communication Channel
cards.body: Select how you want to interact with OpenClaw - through CLI, WhatsApp, or other gateway options.
bullets: WhatsApp: Send prompts from your phone anywhere
CLI: Direct terminal interaction for development
Other gateways: Slack, Discord, or custom integrations
cards.safe: You can always add more channels later from the dashboard.

cards.title: OpenClaw + Anti-Gravity Connected!
cards.body: You've successfully wired OpenClaw to Anti-Gravity with OAuth authentication, selected your AI models, and configured communication channels. Your autonomous engineering team foundation is ready. Next, we'll add specialist agents to supercharge your capabilities.

cards.title: Install Anti-Gravity Agent Kit
cards.body: Add the specialist agent toolkit to unlock builder, reviewer, debugger, and UX designer agents that can be called from OpenClaw.
cards.codeCaption: This provides specialized agents for different development tasks
bullets: Builder agents: Create and scaffold applications
Reviewer agents: Code review and quality checks
Debugger agents: Error detection and fixing
UX Designer agents: Interface and experience improvements

troubleshoot.label: Package not found
troubleshoot.fix: Verify the exact package name from the Anti-Gravity documentation as it may have changed

try.prompt: Install the Anti-Gravity agent kit to unlock specialist agents

commands.output:
‚úì @antigravity/agent-kit@1.2.0 installed globally
‚úì Builder agent available
‚úì Reviewer agent available
‚úì Debugger agent available
‚úì UX Designer agent available
commands.hint: This installs all the specialist agents you can use with slash commands

cards.title: Using Slash Commands with Agents
cards.body: Once your agents are installed, you can call specific specialist agents using slash commands in your OpenClaw prompts.
bullets: /builder - Scaffold and create new applications
/reviewer - Review code quality and suggest improvements
/debugger - Identify and fix errors in your code
/ux-designer - Improve user interface and experience

analogy.text: Think of it like @mentioning experts in a chat - each agent specializes in different aspects of development.

initialMessages.content: How do slash commands work with the specialist agents? When you type /builder create a todo app, OpenClaw routes that specific request to the builder agent, which is trained specifically for application scaffolding. It's like having different experts on your team - you wouldn't ask a UX designer to debug server errors, right? Each agent has its specialized training and capabilities.

cards.title: Browse Claw Hub for Skills
cards.body: Explore the Claw Hub marketplace for additional community skills like quota checkers, image generators, and workflow automations.
bullets: Visit the Claw Hub in your OpenClaw dashboard
Browse skills by category (productivity, development, utilities)
Install skills with the npx command shown in each listing
Popular skills: Anti-Gravity quota checker, image generation tools
cards.safe: All skills in Claw Hub are community-reviewed, but always check permissions before installing.

cards.title: Advanced Automation Workflows
cards.body: Take your setup further by combining OpenClaw orchestration with scheduled tasks and specialized commands for fully autonomous operations.
bullets: Cron jobs: Schedule regular tasks like code reviews or deployments
Webhook triggers: Respond to Git commits or issue updates automatically
Multi-agent workflows: Chain builder ‚Üí reviewer ‚Üí debugger sequences
Context persistence: Agents remember project details across sessions

read.body:
The real power emerges when you chain these tools together. For example, you could set up a workflow where:

1. Code Changes Trigger: A git webhook sends a payload to OpenClaw when code is pushed.

2. Builder Agent Reviews: OpenClaw routes the changes to a builder agent that analyzes the diff and suggests improvements.

3. Reviewer Agent Validates: The code then goes through a reviewer agent that checks for bugs, security issues, and style compliance.

4. Auto-deployment: If everything passes, the debugger agent runs tests and deploys automatically.

This creates a fully autonomous development pipeline that runs 24/7, constantly improving your codebase.

codeBlocks.code:
// Example cron job for daily code review
0 9 * * * openclaw run '/reviewer analyze recent-changes'
codeBlocks.caption: Daily automated code review at 9 AM

cards.title: Workflow Understanding Check
cards.question: In the OpenClaw + Anti-Gravity workflow, what is OpenClaw's primary role?

options.text: Executing code and building applications directly
Planning, orchestrating, and routing tasks to specialist agents
Providing free access to AI models

cards.correctFeedback: Perfect! OpenClaw acts as the command center - it understands your requests, makes decisions about which agents to use, and orchestrates the entire workflow while Anti-Gravity handles the actual execution.
cards.wrongFeedback: Think of OpenClaw as the conductor of an orchestra. It doesn't play the instruments (execute code) but decides which musicians (agents) should play when and coordinates the entire performance.

cards.title: Test Your Autonomous Engineering Team
cards.body: Create a test prompt to verify everything is working. Try building a simple app to see OpenClaw orchestrate with Anti-Gravity's specialist agents.
cards.code: openclaw chat "Create a simple todo app with React"
cards.codeCaption: This should trigger the builder agent through Anti-Gravity
bullets: Watch as OpenClaw analyzes your request
See it route to the appropriate builder agent
Observe the agent create files, install dependencies, and build the app
Note how it uses the reviewer agent for quality checks

troubleshoot.label: No response from agents
troubleshoot.fix: Check your OAuth connection is still valid and try re-authenticating with openclaw auth login google-antigravity

source.author: WorldofAI
source.description: Seeing the complete workflow create a beautiful website from a single prompt

cards.title: Your Autonomous Engineering Team is Live!
cards.body: You've successfully created a powerful AI workflow that combines OpenClaw's orchestration with Anti-Gravity's specialist agents. You can now build complete applications from simple prompts, access premium models for free, automate code reviews, and scale your development workflow with specialized AI agents.
